description: Date and time of the bolide detection (UTC)
Longitude of the bolide (°E).
Latitude of the bolide (°N).
Source of the data.
The approximate total radiated energy in the atmosphere (J)
The impact energy of the event (kt) computed from an empirical expression relating radiated and impact energy.
Altitude in kilometers (km) above the reference geoid for the bolide detection.
The magnitude of the bolide’s pre-impact velocity (km/s).
Satellite(s) that detected the bolide.
Human-assigned confidence rating for the detection being a bolide.
Human-assigned description of how bolide-like the observed light curve is.
Uncalibrated integrated energy of the bolide as viewed from GOES-16.
Uncalibrated integrated energy of the bolide as viewed from GOES-17.
Uncalibrated brightness of the bolide as viewed from GOES-16.
Uncalibrated brightness of the bolide as viewed from GOES-17.
Brightness category of the bolide as viewed from GOES-16.
Brightness category of the bolide as viewed from GOES-17.
Unique identifier assigned to the bolide at neo-bolide.ndc.nasa.gov.
A human-written description of the bolide detection
Dict stating, for each sensor, whether or not the bolide was present in more than one pixel, and how far the bolide went.
The computational method used to find the bolide.
Other non-GLM sources which the bolide is present in.
Human-written notes on the bolide detection.
Human-assigned description of how much lightning activity there was nearby at the time of the bolide detection.
Publication status of the bolide.
List of dicts containing extra data from the bolide detection.
Name of the bolide, if it has been named in the media.
Paths to images of the bolide detection at neo-bolide.ndc.nasa.gov.
Paths to csv files of the bolide detection at neo-bolide.ndc.nasa.gov.
Shapely Point object representing the bolide's location on the globe.
The phase of the moon at the time of the bolide detection. 0=new moon, 0.5=full moon, 0.999=almost new moon.
How full the moon was at the time of the bolide detection. 0=new moon, 1=full moon. ~0.25=waxing or waning crescent
The local solar time of the bolide detection.
The altitude of the sun (°) at the time and place of the bolide detection
Date that the data was retrieved from the source (UTC)
